title: Back to basics: Why we chose long-polling over websockets
dot:
digraph G{node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12];subgraph cluster_real_time{label="Real-time Updates System";style=dashed;worker_nodes[label="Worker Nodes
(Node.js / Golang / C# SDKs)"];agent_state[label="Agent State Synchronization"];postgresql[label="PostgreSQL
(Control Plane)"];worker_nodes->postgresql[label="Poll for new jobs"];agent_state->postgresql[label="Poll for execution & state updates"];}subgraph cluster_polling{label="Long Polling Implementation";style=dotted;ttl[label="Time-To-Live (TTL)
Max Polling Duration"];poll_loop[label="Polling Loop
(Periodic database checks)"];success_failure[label="Success/Failure
(End Polling)"];ttl->poll_loop;poll_loop->success_failure[label="Job Status Change"];success_failure->ttl[label="Timeout / Job Completion"];}subgraph cluster_comparison{label="Comparison: Long Polling vs WebSockets";style=dotted;long_polling[label="Long Polling
(HTTP-based, connection held open)"];websockets[label="WebSockets
(Persistent connections)"];long_polling->websockets[label="Advantages & Challenges"];}observability[label="Observability
(Simplified HTTP metrics)"];authentication[label="Authentication
(Standard HTTP security)"];infrastructure[label="Infrastructure
(Standard configuration)"];operational_simplicity[label="Operational Simplicity
(No WebSocket management)"];observability->long_polling;authentication->long_polling;infrastructure->long_polling;operational_simplicity->long_polling;long_polling->observability[label="No new metrics needed"];long_polling->authentication[label="No new auth needed"];long_polling->infrastructure[label="Works with existing setup"];long_polling->operational_simplicity[label="No stateful connections"]; edge[fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];}
